oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ernest H. Peckinpaugh supervising workers at rear of fly-tying room in his Chattanooga manufacturing company.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Founded in 1920 to manufacture the first commercially tied fishing lures, by 1940 the E.H. Peckinpaugh catalog listed 60 different bugs and flies with hundreds of color combinations.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: RG 82: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Business people; Fishing & hunting gear; Laborers; Handicraft
